programme.title: Wildest Africa: Nile: An African Odyssey
programme.desc: The Nile is the longest river in the world. Ancient Egypt, one of the history's most powerful civilizations, depended hugely upon it. Each year, it flooded, replenishing the fields with fertile silt. This automatic irrigation fueled Egypt's economy.

programme.title: Wildest Africa: Okavango: Water in the Desert
programme.desc: The Okavango Delta, a huge emerald oasis in the burning heart of the Kalahari desert, is fed by the Okavango River and this perpetual cycle of wet and dry is the lifeblood of this extraordinary natural Eden.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Vancouver Island: Rivers of Life
programme.desc: Vancouver island is the largest island off the west coast of North America. Glaciers fuel the flow of some of Canada's tallest waterfalls, and an endless network of rivers and creeks provides the ideal habitat for the pacific salmon.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Caribbean: The Wild Side of Paradise
programme.desc: The Caribbean is a tropical paradise. From just a few meters wide, to hundreds of kilometers across, each of the over 7,000 islands are different, and each has its own unique wildlife.

programme.title: Wildest Islands: Sri Lanka: Monsoon Island
programme.desc: Lying like a teardrop in the Indian Ocean, Sri Lanka is an island that defies convention. Poised just six degrees above the equator, it's less than 75,000 km sq in size. But it has enough wildlife to rival a continent.

programme.title: Timeline: Timeline

programme.title: World's Greatest: Coral Islands
programme.desc: The reef systems that gave rise to coral islands support the vast majority of marine species on our planet, but they are under threat. Explore the delicate balance between exploiting and preserving these extraordinary natural wonders.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Volcanoes
programme.desc: There are few sights on earth as compelling as a volcanic eruption. Volcanoes have the potential to cause death and widespread destruction in a heartbeat, but they also give rise to new life and ecosystems.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Island Arks
programme.desc: Cut off from continents, remote islands have become floating arks, attracting migrating species and forging new ones. Take a privileged glimpse into the secret lives of the rare and exotic species that inhabit these lost worlds.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Extreme Animals
programme.desc: Extreme Animals features environments hostile to humans, but havens to many animals. Witness gorgeous glow-worms, high flying condors, parched thorny devils, emperor penguins, and polar bears in this journey through life on the edge.

programme.title: World's Greatest: Drives
programme.desc: A journey by road expands our horizons, allowing us to explore the depth and breadth of whole countries and continents, stopping whenever and wherever we chose.

programme.title: Arthur: The Butler Did...What?/The Trouble with Trophies
programme.desc: Bailey is missing! Muffy discovers a series of clues and is left wondering, who exactly IS Bailey? Then, everyone loves getting trophies, right? It turns out that Fern could not care less about them.

programme.title: Arthur: 1001 Dads/Prunella's Prediction
programme.desc: When Buster insists that he will miss the Father's Day picnic because he has other plans, Arthur is convinced that he's really sad and embarrassed about his parents‚Äô divorce. And Prunella predicts a gift of flashpants, the hot new fashion.

programme.title: Arthur: Fernfern and the Secret of Moose Mountain/Thanks a Lot, Binky
programme.desc: Fern can't wait to climb Moose Mountain so that she can have adventures like Zutzut, the famous comic-book hero! Then, Binky decides to become "No More Mr. Nice Guy" after not getting thanked for saving Rattles from a dangerous stunt.

programme.title: Arthur: D.W.'s New Best Friend/Freaky Tuesday
programme.desc: D.W. meets 13-year-old Hana, who is much older and totally cool! Is Hana D.W's new BFF? Then, Buster is convinced teachers have it easy. Can he put himself in Mr. Ratburn‚Äôs shoes to find out what it‚Äôs like to be a teacher?

programme.title: Arthur: Unfinished/D.W., Bossy Boots
programme.desc: Arthur is completely riveted by a book and can't wait to see how it ends. But the last few pages are missing! Now what? For D.W., there's nothing better than getting her own way--that is, until all her friends stop playing with her.

programme.title: Arthur: The Chronicles of Buster/On this Spot
programme.desc: Buster learns that special effects can't take the place of hard work when conquering real mountains. Arthur is thrilled to find out that Sitting Bull once passed through town! He rallies the residents to mark the spot with a monument.

programme.title: Arthur: Elwood City Turns 100!
programme.desc: Arthur and his friends commemorate their 100th episode in style! Mr. Ratburn's class is chosen to stage a musical tribute to Elwood City for its centennial celebration, which quickly becomes a drama behind the curtain!

programme.title: Arthur: Background Blues/And Now Let's Talk To Some Kids
programme.desc: Wouldn't it be cool to find out that your ancestors were famous frontier explorers? But what if they were just...plain folks? The Magic Toolbox show is coming to Ratburn's class to put the kids on TV!

programme.title: Arthur: Get Smart/Baby Steps
programme.desc: Everyone loves HUGO--the new interactive whiteboard that claims to be 100% accurate. If only Mr. Ratburn knew how to use it. Mei Lin can say "hello" AND play the piano?!? Kate can't even wave!

programme.title: NEW: World War II in HD Colour
programme.desc: Japan continues its suicidal resistance, and invading it looks costly. After 2 atomic bombs, the Emperor intervenes and stops the War. Stalin grabs territory in East Asia. The War is over, and the Atomic Era and the Cold War start.

programme.title: NEW: World War II in HD Colour
programme.desc: In 1945, Germany is crumbly on both fronts. The Western Allies cross the Rhine and take most of Germany, while the Red Army quickly advances into Berlin. After Hitler's suicide, Germany surrenders and is divided among the allied powers.

programme.title: NEW: World War II in HD Colour
programme.desc: The Marines succeed in the "island hopping" strategy against suicidal resistance. The US Navy establishes supremacy, cutting off Japan.

programme.title: NEW: World War II in HD Colour
programme.desc: The Western Allies secure supply routes that will allow them to enter Germany, and the Ardennes counter-offensive fails. The Red Army advances rapidly. The SS implements the Holocaust.

programme.title: NEW: World War II in HD Colour
programme.desc: After a careful campaign of disinformation that throws the German defenders off-guard, the Western Allies finally land on Normandy.France is liberated.

programme.desc: A year after meeting 'T-lights' on Instagram, 'instaceleb' Antoinette is ready to meet him, but he always brushes off the idea. Is he really the online celebrity he claims to be?

programme.title: Catfish: The TV Show: Jeff & Megan
programme.desc: After a string of bad luck with women, Jeff believes he has finally found his dream girl Megan. However, Megan is starting to sound off Catfish alarms.
